data.title: Welcome Back, Woodburn! Date Correction!
data.text:
Para obtener una versión traducida de este mensaje, haga clic AQUÍ. Luego, haga clic en el icono IDIOMA en la esquina superior izquierda para elegir su idioma preferido.

Dear Woodburn Families,

We are eager to see you at our Welcome Walk and Open House events this Thursday. Please see below for more information about each event.

As we start the year, we are committed to building warm and welcoming classroom communities and to establishing positive relationships with each of our students. All of our students deserve to be valued and feel a sense of belonging. We will make this happen.

Thank you for your ongoing support and partnership. We look forward to working alongside you this school year!

Together We Grow,

Katy & Kelley

Upcoming Events

August 17 - Welcome Walk, 10:00am-12:30pm

August 17 - Open House, 3:00-4:30pm

August 21 - First Day of School!

September 14 - Back to School Night, 6:30pm

2023-2024 FCPS Calendar

Welcome Walk and Open House - THURSDAY!

Welcome Walk: 10:00am– 12:30pm.

Your child’s teacher will visit your home for a brief introduction

K-3 teachers will begin their walk at Fairmont Gardens

4-6 teachers will begin their walk within Holmes Run, Lafayette, and surrounding neighborhoods

Open House: 3:00pm–4:30pm

Bring your child to visit their new classroom and receive information about the school year.

Classroom Presentations will be held at 3:10pm and 3:40pm

Visit the cafeteria to sign up for the PTA

Outdoor Celebration: Families will be invited to enjoy popsicles outside from 4:00-4:30pm

A bus will be provided from the Fairmont Gardens entrance to Woodburn beginning at 3:00pm and will run until 3:45pm. Return trips will begin at 4:00pm and the last return trip will leave Woodburn at 4:45pm.

First Day!

Walking Your Child to Class on the 1st Day

In the past we have allowed families of our youngest wildcats to walk their child to class on the first day of school. We have adjusted this practice and will not be permitting families to walk their child to the classroom on the first day. This is to ensure the safety of our students, staff, and community. Many staff will be greeting our students and can assist them to class.

First Day Photos

We want to see your first day photos! Please email Kelley Dauberman, our acting assistant principal any photos that you are comfortable with us sharing on our social media platforms. Let's celebrate the start of a new year together!

Arrival and Dismissal Information

Arrival begins at 9:05 am. The school day begins at 9:20 am.

Dismissal begins at 4:05 pm.

Kiss and Ride

Families who drive their child to school will receive their Kiss and Ride number on the first day. We appreciate your patience as the kiss & ride line might be slow during the first few days of school.

Walkers

Families who walk their child to and from school are to meet their child at the main entrance. Please stand clear of the main doors so that we can help students exit in an orderly manner.

Bus Riders

We appreciate your patience and understanding if the bus arrives a few minutes early or late during the first few days of school. The drivers are figuring out their new routes.

Woodburn First Day Packet – Important Forms

Students will be sent home with "First Day Packets" on Monday, August 21. This folder contains forms that we need all families to complete. Many forms can be submitted online and are shared below. Thank you for taking the time to share this important information with us.

Included:

School hours/important phone numbers

PTA Information

FAMIS Healthcare information

Free and Reduced-Price Meal Information

School Health Room Information

Title 1 Information

Annual Notice of Survey, Records, Curriculum, etc. Opt-Out

The following forms need to be completed. Once complete you can either drop them off at school or take a picture of your completed form and email it to KBaker1@fcps.edu.

Identification of Military Connected Students

Homeless Student Referral

SRR (Student Rights & Responsibilities) Acknowledgement Form (can be completed in ParentVue)

FC Sexual Harassment Lessons- 6th grade ONLY

The following forms can be completed electronically:

Health Form (access in WeCare found on 24/7)

Emergency Care Information (access in WeCare found on 24/7)

Free and Reduced lunch Applications (https://www.myschoolapps.com/)

Various Opt-Out Forms (https://www.fcps.edu/registration/opt-out-forms)

Digital Resources (https://digitalconsent.fcps.edu/ispb/is01/r/pdcp/login?session=8548000393750)

Student Right and Responsibilities:

Digital acknowledgement in ParentVue: https://www.fcps.edu/srr

Signed paper form: https://www.fcps.edu/sites/default/files/media/forms/SRRSignatureSheet.pdf

Reporting Absences

There are several ways to report your child's absence:

Call 703-641-8282 (Press #1 for English and #2 for Spanish)

Complete our online attendance form.

Email WoodburnElem.Attendance@fcps.edu

Breakfast and Lunch

Students who do not qualify for free or reduced meals will pay for breakfast and lunch. All students will enter a pin number for meals. This number has been shared with you through email and by your child's teacher. We know that students will need time to learn their number and will ensure all become familiar with this new process.

Breakfast: Students will be able to pick up breakfast from the cafeteria each morning and then eat in their classroom. They will need to type in their pin number.

Lunch: Students will travel through the lunch line and need to enter their pin number.

More information about meal prices and payment can be found here.

Digital Resources Consent

At Woodburn, our teachers will use a variety of digital resources to support student learning and promote communication and collaboration with students and families. Some of the digital resources your child may use this year will require your consent before they can be used. You can find the list of the resources that require parental consent on the FCPS Digital Consent page. The enrolling parent or guardian should complete this form as soon as possible, as your child will not be able to use the digital resources until we have received your permission. Please reach out to Kelley Dauberman at krdauberman@fcps.edu if you have questions or concerns about the digital resources we’ve chosen to use this year.

Woodburn 2023-2024 PTA Board

President - Katie Sessa, PTAPresident@gmail.com

Vice President - Carrie Darke, PTAVicePresident@gmail.com

Treasurer - Dan McGarry, PTATreasurer@gmail.com

Secretary - Abby Jenkins, PTASecretary@gmail.com

Student Monitors Needed

Woodburn is looking for student monitors to join our staff. This is an hourly position. Please reach out to Katy at kjrichman@fcps.edu or 703-641-8200 if interested.

Student Monitors:

Description: Provides supervision of students throughout the school day to include but not limited to the classroom, hallways, lunch, recess, specials and at arrival/dismissal; helps maintain order and discipline and assists in managing the behavior of students; operates technology; performs administrative and non-instructional duties; ensures all layered prevention/safety protocols and procedures are implemented and followed; works with individual and small groups of students.

Hourly: $16.85/hr

Follow Us

Facebook - @Woodburn ES

Instagram - @WoodburnElementaryFCPS

Woodburn School Website

FCPS Cares
